Award.AwardTitle: Geometric Methods in the Representation Theory of Affine Hecke Algebras, Finite Reductive Groups, and Character Sheaves
Award.AbstractNarration:
Representation theory is a branch of algebra studying symmetries, especially symmetries of linear mathematical structures, using groups of invertible matrices. In this project the linear structures are themselves finite matrix groups, or more generally matrix groups whose entries satisfy divisibility properties with respect to a fixed prime number. Geometrical and combinatorial techniques will be brought to bear to study representations of these groups, especially in the important case when the representing matrices themselves have entries that satisfy divisibility properties.

This research project will advance the representation theory of reductive algebraic groups. The PI will study questions stemming from a promising new method using the notion of categorical centers, as well as questions related to unipotent representations and character sheaves, canonical bases of Hecke algebras, "almost characters" of p-adic groups, and W-graphs associated to involutions.

POR.DRECONTENT:
In my paper (Non-unipotent representations...) I show that the irreduciblerepresentations of a finite reductive groups are in bijection with the simple objectsof certain categories constructed purely in terms of the flag manifold; this extends my earlierresult which applied only to unipotent representations. I believe this new approach givesa new understanding of the representations of finite reductive group.
In a series of joint papers with Z. Yun (Z/m-graded Lie algebras and perverse sheaves I-IV)we study the local intersection cohomology of the closures of nilpotent orbits in a fixed graded component of acyclically graded simple Lie algebra. We give an algorithm to compute it which shows that itvanishes in odd degrees. This generalizes known results in the ungraded case and in the case graded by integers.Our results are new even in the case of symmetric spaces.In another joint paper with Z.Yun (Endoscopy...sheaves) we prove a monodromic version of the theory of Soergel bimodules.One application of this result (combined with my recent results on the character sheaves as a categorical  centre) is a new proof of the ``Jordan decomposition'' for character sheaves which I proved earlier using case by case considerations.In another paper (A new basis...) I find a new basis of the representation ring of a Weyl group. This basis consists ofirreducible representations which interpolate between special representations and representations carried by theleft cells of the Weyl group. One application is a new parametrization of the irreducible representationsof a Weyl group. The methods of this paper are extended in a sequel to this paper (The Grothendieck group...)where I find a new basis for the Grothendieck group of unipotent representations of a finite Chevalley group.In the period of this grant I wrote four papers developing the theory of total positivity in reductive groups.For example I found a description by generators and relations of the totally positive part of a reductive groupand I developed a theory of total positivity for Springer fibres.In a joint paper with G.Williamson (Billiards...), we discovered a new pattern in the theory of tilting modules for the group SL(3)over a field of positive characteristic; the new pattern is reminiscent of the movement of a ball on a triangularbilliard table.In my paper (Lifting involutions....) I define a new way to lift the involutions in a Weyl to the normalizer of amaximal torus (different from the Tits lifting). This is applied in my paper (Hecke modules based....) to generalize my olderpaper with Vogan.
